concept.title: Short descriptions in the ditamap
concept.shortdesc: Short descriptions specified in a DITA topic can be overriden by alternative short description elements in the ditamap.

keywords.indexterm: overriding topic metadata in the ditamap

conbody.p: A short description (shortdesc) element naturally belongs in the topic. The short description is typically rendered in the output as:

ul.li: the first paragraph of the topic
subordinate topic preview text in the topic's parent

conbody.p: In some circumstances, you may want to override the subordinate topic preview text with a publication-specific, alternative short description. To do this, you need to specify the alternative short description in the ditamap. This is done by adding a shortdesc element to the topicmeta element within the topicref.

An example of the topicref mark-up is: <topicref href="c_starting_xrw.dita" format="dita"> <topicmeta> <shortdesc>The XRW is started by entering the PIN into the security keypad, and then turning the ignition key.</shortdesc> </topicmeta> </topicref>
conbody.note: Setting a linktext element within the topicref's topicmeta will similarly result in the generated hierarchical links in hypertext output using this alternative link text, rather than the topic's title.

section.title: Rationale

lq.reftitle: Kris Eberlein, Yahoo! DITA Users Group

section.lq: You can use the content of a <shortdesc> set at the DITA map level to override ONLY the short description used for link previews. There is one exception: You set the @copy-to attribute on the <topicref> element.

section.p: In other cases, you may want to override all instances of the topic's short description with an alternative short description specified in the map. To do this, you must set the copy-to attribute in the topicref element in the map to specify an alternative file name for a second copy of the output file. When this nominated file is created, the shortdesc (and any linktext element, if specified) in the topic reference will be used in the duplicated topic.

In the following example, the output HTML topic will be named wrx_start.html, because the copy-to is specifying an alternative DITA file name of wrx_start.dita. <topicref href="c_starting_wrx.dita" copy-to="wrx_start.dita" > <topicmeta> <shortdesc>The WRX is started by entering the PIN into the security keypad, and then turning the ignition key.</shortdesc> </topicmeta> </topicref>All short description instances will use the ditamap topicref's short description rather than the topic's.
